author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a relief for over 600 passengers stranded due to the closure of the Brussels airport after terrorist attacks since Tuesday morning, the Jet Airways on Thursday operated a single recovery flight which will fly from Amsterdam to Delhi and then proceed onward to Mumbai. In Delhi the flight is scheduled to land at 6-10 am and in Mumbai at 8-10 am on Friday.

The schedule for Jet Airways flights from Amsterdam to Toronto remains unchanged. Alternative arrangements have been made for passengers travelling to Newark, the airline said.

On Wednesday the passengers travelled from Brussels to Amsterdam by road in 15 buses, a distance of around 200 km and boarded flights to different destinations on Thursday.

“The airline had made hotel arrangements in Amsterdam for their overnight stay, before they continued onward journey to their destination,” a Jet Airways spokesperson said. The airline said it worked closely with the Belgian authorities and the Indian Embassy to facilitate an early transit for passengers and crew from Brussels.
title: Jet Airways flight to evacuate stranded passengers
